section.title: Introduction
section.p: Use the "blank" Control sample (located at <BeehiveRoot>/samples/controls-blank) as a template for building your own Control projects.
section.note: <BeehiveRoot> refers to the top-level directory of your Beehive installation. A typical value for <BeehiveRoot> would be /apache/apache-beehive-1.0.
section.p: The template contains a basic 'Hello World' control to get you started. Control projects can be archived in a JAR file and then imported into multiple applications. Simply import the JAR archive into the application's WEB-INF/lib directory.

section.title: Using the Control Project Template
section.p: The following instruction assume that you have completed the basic Beehive set up procedure at Set Up the Dev Environment.

(1) Copy the contents of <BeehiveRoot>/samples/controls-blank into your project folder (referred to as <Project-Folder> below). (Or copy controls-blank to another location and rename it as <Project-Folder>.)

(2) In the file controls-blank/build.properties, edit the beehive.home property so it points to <BeehiveRoot> (the top-level folder of your beehive installation). This will produce a distributable JAR file at: <Project-Folder>/build/mycontrols.jar.
To use the JAR in your other projects (like a web project or a web service project), copy mycontrols.jar into the project's WEB-INF/lib directory.
